item.title: Glutathione and Vitamin D synergism - many studies
item.description:
1. Increased Glutathione (the master antioxidant) increases cellular and blood vitamin D

  2. Vitamin D increases Glutathione

  3. Glutathione can be increased in many ways, such as using liposomal form

One company claims their liposomal form is 64X more bioavailable

      • The Ultimate Crash Course on Glutathione! - video April 2024** YouTube, 51 minutes **3:45 Functions
      • GLUTATHIONE FOR BEGINNERS - Amazon book, Dec 2023 (free if Kindle Unlimited)** Unlocking Health And Vitality, The Comprehensive Guide To Boost Your Immunity, Detoxify Your Body, Combat Aging, And Rejuvenate Your Cells **33 pages - I have not looked at it
      • Vitamin D, Glutathione & NAC: new relationships you should know - 2022 video** YouTube, 23 minutes **—
      • Increased Vitamin D in both cells and blood when Glutathione (GSH) is increased – June 2024** The Impact of Vitamin D and L-Cysteine Co-Supplementation on Upregulating Glutathione and Vitamin D-Metabolizing Genes and in the Treatment of Circulating 25-Hydroxy Vitamin D Deficiency **Nutrients Volume 16 Issue 13 10.3390/nu16132004
      • Glutathione improved vitamin D levels and 6 Vitamin D genes (more gets to cells) (mice) - 2018** Glutathione Stimulates Vitamin D Regulatory and Glucose-Metabolism Genes, Lowers Oxidative Stress and Inflammation, and Increases 25-Hydroxy-Vitamin D Levels in Blood: A Novel Approach to Treat 25-Hydroxyvitamin D Deficiency **Antioxidants & Redox SignalingVol. 29, No. 17 https://doi.org/10.1089/ars.2017.7462
      • What are possible good ways to increase glutathione levels in the body? Asked Perplexity AI June 2024
      • Review of 11 Glutathione Supplements - ConsumerLab June 2024** ConsumerLab **Price of 200 mg ranges from $0.17 cents to $2.88
      • 3 videos by Dr. Anderson on Glutathione
      • One liposomal Glutathione product was found to be 64X more bio-available than standard** Study on the bioavailability of glutathione **
      • How long does it take for liposomal glutathione to show effects (spoiler: 1 week) - asked Perplexity AI June 2024
      • What supplements increase Glutathione levels in the body (NAC best?) - Asked Perplexity AI June 2024
      • >50 liposomal Glutathoine products on Amazon** I chose a low-cost lipospmal form in capsules with > 400 in monthly sales **Seems good - as of Oct 2024 - I am starting on my 3rd bottle.
      • Have glutathione levels decreased recently (spolier: YES) - asked Chat-GPT 4.o June 2024
      • Glutathione, cataract and liposomal search found 4,100 items as of Oct 2024** Google Scholar__
What is glutathione - Asked Perplexity AI June 2024

Glutathione is a powerful antioxidant naturally produced in every cell of the human body.

item.title: Vitamin D Receptor activation by Traditional Chinese Medicine
item.description:
Vitamin D Receptor activation has been proven to get more Vitamin D into the cells,
This study adds many more VDR activators, many of which are on Amazon
For most activators it is not known
    Which activator is best for each health problem
    Dose size
    Dose Frequency (X doses per day – X doses per month)
   Should dosing be constant, ramp up, or start with a loading dose

    • Modulation of the vitamin D receptor by traditional Chinese medicines and bioactive compounds: potential therapeutic applications in VDR-dependent diseases
      • Introduction
      • Vitamin D receptor: expression, function, and structure
      • VDR and human diseases
      • Therapeutic applications of TCM and bioactive compounds in VDR- dependent cancer diseases
      • Natural bioactive compounds targeting VDR activity
      • Challenges, limitations, and future directions

Modulation of the vitamin D receptor by traditional Chinese medicines and bioactive compounds: potential therapeutic applications in VDR-dependent diseases

Front. Pharmacol. 15:1298181. doi: 10.3389/fphar.2024.1298181

item.title: Vitamin D Danger - Women need 70 ng for optimal Estrogen - video and transcript
item.description:
• The #1 Vitamin D Danger You Must Know! | Dr. Mindy Pelz
      • Transcript
      • See also VitaminDWiki

The #1 Vitamin D Danger You Must Know! | Dr. Mindy Pelz

YouTube 14 minute

Transcript

0:00:00.1 Pelz: vitamin d , we gotta talk about it. It’s too important. And I have done videos quoting many studies here. I’ve got a lot more for you to understand about vitamin d . I will put all the studies and all the links to those of you that are science hounds in the notes to this video. But I feel like this is one of those videos, we gotta roll up our sleeves and we gotta have a serious talk because so many of you are low in vitamin d . And vitamin d , hopefully, you know, is not only supportive of the immune system, but you need it for hormonal production. In fact, vitamin d is not even considered a vitamin, it’s a hormone and it’s in charge of a thousand different processes in your body.

item.title: Off topic: Skin aging reversed with by oral collagen – trials and reviews
item.description:
• Why Collagen Is a Proven Necessity - Mercola Sept 2023
      • 9 grams oral collagen increased skin elasticity by ~ 50% - RCT March 2019
      • Oral Collagen helps skin - review Jan 2019
      • 5 grams oral collagen helped skin - RCT 2015
      • How to Get More Collagen, and Why Your Skin Needs It to Stay Young
      • What’s The Deal With Collagen? - Sept 2023
      • The most abundant protein in mammals- Wikipedia 2019
      • See also VitaminDWiki
      • Collagen descreases with age

Why Collagen Is a Proven Necessity - Mercola Sept 2023

  • Collagen is the most common and abundant of your body’s proteins, accounting for about 30% of the total protein in your body. One of its primary purposes is to provide structural scaffolding to allow tissues to stretch and flex while maintaining tissue integrity

item.title: Prematurely aging kids (Hutchinson-Gilford Progeria Syndrome) might be helped by Vitamin D
item.description:
Scientists discover new causes of cellular decline in prematurely aging kids

  • Extremely rare: Fewer than 1,000 cases per year in the US

  • “HGPS is caused by the random mutation of a single gene that causes children to age rapidly. Children with the condition develop many of the typical changes and illness associated with aging, including hair loss, aging skin, joint abnormalities, and bone loss. The disease causes atherosclerosis—fatty deposits that clog arteries—and patients with the illness die from cardiovascular complications such as stroke or myocardial infarction in their teens.”

item.title: ICU cost reduced by at least 27,000 dollars if get high dose vitamin D in first week
item.description:
• 10 fewer days of ICU Mechanical Ventilation 300,000 IU injection of vitamin D – RCT March 2019

  • Vitamin D and Glutamine reduced Trauma Center deaths by half – Matthews March 2017 Matthews

  • Chance of dying in hospital cut in half by just 10 ng higher level of Vitamin D – April 2016

  • ICU death rate reduced 3X when a vitamin D injection changed the PTH – Nov 2015

  • Hospital ICU added high dose vitamin D - malpractice lawsuit costs dropped from 26 million dollars to ZERO - Oct 2016 same hospital as study on this page

item.title: 5X more likely to have facial skin aging if vitamin D insufficient
item.description:
Association of facial skin aging and vitamin D levels in middle-aged white women.

Cancer Causes Control. 2010 Dec;21(12):2315-6. doi: 10.1007/s10552-010-9646-y. Epub 2010 Sep 30.

Chang AL, Fu T, Amir O, Tang JY.

Department of Dermatology, Stanford University School of Medicine, 450 Broadway, Pavilion C, MC 5334, Redwood City, CA 94305, USA.

To investigate the relationship between UV-induced skin photodamage and 25(OH) vitamin D levels, we performed a cross-sectional study in 45 female subjects aged >40. Menopausal status, smoking status, skin cancer history, oral supplement use, and season of blood draw were recorded and serum 25(OH)D measured. A single-blinded, dermatologist evaluated standardized digital facial images for overall photodamage, erythema/telangiectasias, hyperpigmentation, number of lentigines, and wrinkling. Adjusting for age and season of blood collection, women with lower photodamage scores were associated with a 5-fold increased odds of being vitamin D insufficient (OR 5.0, 95% CI: 1.1, 23). Low scores for specific photodamage parameters including erythema/telangiectasias, hyperpigmentation, and wrinkling were also significantly associated with vitamin D insufficiency. Our results suggest an association between skin aging and 25(OH)D levels.

item.title: Low Vitamin D Levels Associated With Increased Risk for Cognitive Impairment
item.description:
from Medscape http://www.medscape.com/viewarticle/725009

Susan Jeffrey

July 13, 2010 (Honolulu, Hawaii) — Results of a new analysis using data from the Third National Health and Nutrition Survey (NHANES III) show that vitamin D deficiency is associated with an increased risk for cognitive impairment in older Americans.

The findings echo those from a second report from the same group in a different cohort showing that low levels of vitamin D were associated with subsequent cognitive decline during 6 years of follow-up.

item.title: 10 Reasons You Should Be Tested for Vitamin D – Huffington
item.description:
Nalini Chilkov April 16 2010 (as of May 21, 2010: 243 comments, 1,128 retween views, 427 Facebook share)

Leader/Expert: Alternative Medicine and Integrative Cancer Care doctornalini.com

http://www.huffingtonpost.com/nalini-chilkov/10-reasons-you-should-be_b_525914.html

Life Saving and Health Promoting Benefits of Vitamin D:

  • Vitamin D can reduce your risk of the flu and complications of flu.

Vitamin D contributes to lowering the incidence of infections and inflammation during the fall-winter flu season. The Canadian government has recommended increased Vitamin D intake as part of their flu prevention strategy, including prevention of H1N1 Swine Flu.

item.title: Why you are probably NOT getting enough vitamin D - Dr. Hyman
item.description:
Vitamin D: Why You Are Probably NOT Getting Enough and How That Makes You Sick

Mark Hyman, MD Practicing physician and pioneer in functional medicine May 22, 2010

http://www.huffingtonpost.com/dr-mark-hyman/vitamin-d-why-you-are-pro_b_585311.html

  • What vitamin may we need in amounts up to 25 times higher than the government recommends for us to be healthy?

  • What vitamin deficiency affects 70-80 percent of the population, is almost never diagnosed and has been linked to many cancers, high blood pressure, heart disease, diabetes, depression,(i) fibromyalgia, chronic muscle pain, bone loss and autoimmune diseases like multiple sclerosis?(ii)

item.title: 10 reasons to be tested for vitamin D
item.description:
Nalini Chilkov

Leader/Expert: Alternative Medicine and Integrative Cancer Care doctornalini.com Posted: April 16, 2010

http://www.huffingtonpost.com/nalini-chilkov/10-reasons-you-should-be_b_525914.html

Vitamin D can reduce your risk of the flu and complications of flu . Vitamin D contributes to lowering the incidence of infections and inflammation during the fall-winter flu season. The Canadian government has recommended increased Vitamin D intake as part of their flu prevention strategy, including prevention of H1N1 Swine Flu.

Vitamin D can reduce your risk of depression . Low levels of Vitamin D are associated with depression. Sun exposure is known to be a factor in relieving depression, especially winter depression also known as seasonal affective disorder.

item.title: Wrinkles and UVB
item.description:
• Middle-aged wrinkles 5.6 X more likely if insufficient Vitamin D - 2010
      • Clippings from the web  March 2010
      • See also VitaminDWiki

Middle-aged wrinkles 5.6 X more likely if insufficient Vitamin D - 2010

Association of facial skin aging and vitamin D levels in middle-aged white women

Anne Lynn S. Chang, Teresa Fu, Omar Amir & Jean Y. Tang

Cancer Causes & Control volume 21, pages2315–2316 (2010)

t

To investigate the relationship between UV-induced skin photodamage and 25(OH) vitamin D levels, we performed a cross-sectional study in 45 female subjects aged >40. Menopausal status, smoking status, skin cancer history, oral supplement use, and season of blood draw were recorded and serum 25(OH)D measured. A single-blinded, dermatologist evaluated standardized digital facial images for overall photodamage, erythema/telangiectasias, hyperpigmentation, number of lentigines, and wrinkling. Adjusting for age and season of blood collection, women with lower photodamage scores were associated with a 5-fold increased odds of being vitamin D insufficient (OR 5.0, 95% CI: 1.1, 23). Low scores for specific photodamage parameters including erythema/telangiectasias, hyperpigmentation, and wrinkling were also significantly associated with vitamin D insufficiency. Our results suggest an association between skin aging and 25(OH)D levels.
